title: The Media’s Role In Edward Snowden’s Disclosure
teaser: David Folkenflik discusses Snowden’s interview, Glenn Greenwald’s book and the media's role in sharing national security secrets.
contentencoded:
Last night on NBC, Nightly News anchor Brian Williams sat down with Edward Snowden, in his first U.S. network television interview since leaking information about the U.S. government’s sweeping surveillance efforts.

Glenn Greenwald, the go-between journalist for Snowden and some of the newspapers that reported on Snowden’s disclosure, also joined in on the conversation.

In Greenwald’s new book “No Place to Hide,” he chronicles the events of the last year; however, the book has sparked some significant media controversy.

NPR Media Correspondent David Folkenflik joins Here & Now’s Robin Young to discuss Snowden’s interview, Greenwald’s book and the role of the media in sharing national security secrets.

Guest

  • David Folkenflik, media correspondent for NPR. He tweets @davidfolkenflik.
